creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: child at R standing proudly, holding a glass in his PL hand; two boys seated on floor at LL, looking towards standing boy; dog near LRC; interior of a dark room
inscription:
Signature, Label 

-- in graphite on verso: P 5470 | MC-83-17-MP-HL
-- in graphite on verso, bottom edge of sheet: [CD 2 ii/iii rare early imp. before completion of shading] 
-- label on back of mount: N.W. Lott & H.J. Gerrish Ltd, 14 Masons Yard, Duke St., St. James\'s, London SW1, and The Old Rectory, Froxfield, Marlborough, Wiltshire
provenance: William Esdaile (1758-1837), cf. Lugt 2617, London. [N. W. Lott & H. J. Gerrish Ltd., London and Wiltshire.] [Paul McCarron, New York; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: initialed in plate, lower right: [DW]; initialed in plate below the image, lower left: [DW]
title: Interior with Three Boys and a Dog
